intro: Tithymalus thomsonianus, commonly known as the Thomson's tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to regions of Central and South America. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
